author: Rfranks08
title: Idea to Team Connection Support
description: Some folks with good ideas and business acumen cant code; some folks who can code don't have the business acumen

assessments.note: The basic idea "to connect entrepreneurs and developers" is an important issue that has to be solved and it could somehow help entrepreneurs to join Catalyst. However, this proposal remains vague about a potential solution. It only provides initial thoughts and  the requested funding is intended to be used to identify a specific solution.
While the problem is valid, it is not in line with the goal of the challenge, which is to attract new proposers. This goal will help proposers form teams.
The challenge is "How can we encourage entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano ecosystem to submit proposals to Catalyst in the next two funds?" This proposal doesn't answer that challenge.

The proposer is seeking to add "talent requested" tag to proposals on Ideascale. This feature already exists. Also, this does not satisfy the category challenge and will not attract proposers in the next two funds.

The proposal is noble in approach and something that definitely can improve how ideas and developers, entrepreneurs and leaders could bring a great idea but poor chances of successful implementation to gather more caliber and clarity for a roadmap creation in many of the strong ideas but lacking the expertise and support to deliver them.

i get the idea of this proposal i.e. to create a better way to connect talent, which would be valuable for this challenge, but it's very very undeveloped and asking for funds to further develop the "vision" is not appropriate
There is no description of how the proposal will address the challenge.

The proposer says he has a lot experience. However, there is no proof for this (no links or examples are provided). There is short plan how the proposer wants to find a solution but there are no KPIs to measure the process. This proposal does not plan to implement anything in this funding round. The budget is likely to be used for the time invested (no specific description provided). But I think the amount is reasonable.
This proposal is a relatively small scope and the proposer's experience fits well with it.
You have understood the challenge wrong.
This proposal will not be implemented as this feature already exists on Ideascale.

There seams to be an abundance of experience from the proposal to lead a progress towards the defined goals defined. More clarity on how this will be executed requires attention in this proposal to build on the confidence that it can be carried out successfully.
There is no plan presented, the funds being requested would be to design the plan. It's not clear what experience the proposer has to implement this proposal

There is no tangible plan and because of that it is not possible to understand the relevance of the proposer's experience to the proposal. I recommend that the proposal show greater clarity in its mission. One of the described suggestions already exists in Ideascale, adding a tag is a simple UI implementantion on the IdeaScale website, it doesn't make sense to place it as something highlighted in the proposal.

The proposal does not provide sufficient information (no KPIs to measure progress). The proposer did not respond to the comment received that has asked for further details (at the time of this review). I like the basic idea and the proposer could potentially contribute to connect developers and entrepreneurs. But this potential is hard to see for me.
The proposal doesn't identify how it will bring in new proposers if successfully implemented.
Askin 3,000 USD to come up with a vision is not the way to go.

The proposal does provide information on desirable delivarables that will be achieved with the funds requested. The proposal could also benefit with an approximate timeline for deliverables. Good luck to proposer in future funds!.

Unfortunately the proposal has a basic roadmap, more detailed and clear metrics need to be expanded on to assess the changes that need to be implemented, a structured approach and how to onboard different teams from different proposals but similar ideas together to create more quality for their solutions.
Almost no information is provided , the deliverables described should have all be done as part of designing this proposal. No metric of success are defined

The information described doesn't indicate how the proposal will address the challenge. The proposal needs refinement and the inclusion of roadmap, milestones, KPIs, budget details and details about the proposer's experience / qualification.

solution: Allow proposal submitters to identify what they need to push their idea or team to the next level.
experience:
12 years building teams to deliver tech solutions;
an always increasing appreciation that it's important to know what you don't know
